BR_text.BRdescription:
Short summary about the issue/question:
 Run example 'examples/trials/network_morphism/cifar10', then get
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: NetworkMorphism should be installed through 'nnictl package install --name NetworkMorphism'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 But, if I try to 'install NetworkMorphism', there cames
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: NetworkMorphism is not supported!
 </denchmark-code>
 
 And, accroding to the doc, I don't think we need to install NetworkMorphism before using it.
 How to reproduce it:
 Clone the repo, install the lastest nni from pypi, and run the 'examples/trials/network_morphism/cifar10' example.
 <denchmark-code>nnictl create -c config.yml
 </denchmark-code>
 
 nni Environment:
 
 nni version: 0.9.1
 nni mode(local|pai|remote): local
 OS: ubuntu 16.04
 python version: python3.6
 is conda or virtualenv used?: no
 is running in docker?: no
 
 need to update document(yes/no): no
 Anything else we need to know: Thanks a lot~

comments_0.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xlthu>@xlthu</denchmark-link>
  thank you for your question.  Seems there might be a bug after we refine the installation code.
 The dependency of network morphism including(could manually install for now):
 
 
 numpy
 
 
 scipy
 
 
 sklean
 
 
 pytorch
 
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/leelaylay>@leelaylay</denchmark-link>
   could you help to check this problem? thanks.

comments_1.comment_text:
I think the reason is that nni/networkmorphism_tuner/bayesian.py imports OptimizeMode from wrong file.
 Should be
 <denchmark-code>from nni.utils import OptimizeMode
 </denchmark-code>
 
 But we have
 <denchmark-code>from nni.networkmorphism_tuner.utils import Constant, OptimizeMode
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/nni/blob/master/src/sdk/pynni/nni/networkmorphism_tuner/bayesian.py#L33>Code & Line here</denchmark-link>
 
 Thank you~

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xlthu>@xlthu</denchmark-link>
 
 You are right.  class is imported from wrong file. Thank you for your warm reminder.
 I will fix this problem as soon as possible.

comments_3.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/xlthu>@xlthu</denchmark-link>
 
 The bug is fixed in the master branch and thank you.
 And,  is the build-in tuners which you don't need to install it.  and  are those tuners which you should install it by .
 If you want to know the python requirements of , you can see this file <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/nni/blob/master/examples/trials/network_morphism/requirements.txt>requirements.txt</denchmark-link>
 .
